intro: Erucastrum lasiocalycinum, commonly known as the woolly bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and its small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Erucastrum lasiocalycinum is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
